sanskrit_verse:
इह दुश्चरितैः के चित्के चित्पूर्वकृतैस्तथा ।
प्राप्नुवन्ति दुरात्मानो नरा रूपविपर्ययम् ॥ ११.४८॥
transliteration:
iha duścaritaiḥ ke cit ke cit pūrvakṛtaiḥ tathā |
prāpnuvanti durātmāno narā rūpaviparyayam || 11.48 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Those who commit evil deeds—whether in this life or carried forward from prior births—assume distorted forms due to their degraded consciousness.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from alignment with pure consciousness, not from external power
Causation follows sequential manifestation rooted in individual and collective karma
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by the degree of awareness at time of action
Restoration logic operates through experiential consequence that reflects inner state
Consciousness alignment determines both experience and corrective trajectory
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent performs act misaligned with dharma THEN agent's experiential field shall reflect distortion proportional to degradation of intent
IF karmic residue exists THEN subsequent embodiment shall align with unresolved patterns until completion occurs
IF consciousness distortion is detected THEN initiate reintegration protocol via guided realization, not punitive enforcement
IF agent demonstrates capacity-aware regret THEN reduce experiential dissonance through conscious restoration pathways
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Adjudication, the threshold of responsibility lies in the agent’s capacity-awareness during the act. Authority flows from ontological clarity, not positional dominance. Restoration supersedes retribution by aligning the offender’s experience with内在 causal structure, enabling completion rather than prolonged imbalance.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that suffering arises naturally from misalignment, not as imposed penalty. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential consequences manifest experientially, restoring balance without external infliction. Responsibility is proportional to witnessed awareness; thus, justice aligns outcome with内在 truth, not punitive overlay.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Consciousness Completion Process to allow natural resolution of karmic echo
Deploy Guided Realization Modules to restore perceptual integrity
Establish Karmic Mirror Feedback Loops to enable self-corrective insight
Activate Collective Resonance Integration to dissolve isolating distortions
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law executes the eternal principle: form follows consciousness. Justice is the universe restoring itself through awareness, not punishment. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the Supreme Adjudicator.
